Description: Comprehensive functions check - connectivity
Workflow Steps: interactivity
column8: 1: log "Starting comprehensive functions check for: $mode" 2: create_dir "dataPull_Arch" if not exists; create_file "Master_Instructions.txt" with content: "# Master Instructions - dataPull Agent Learning File..." 3: test_connectivity: ping test; check internet connection; verify system responsiveness 4: test_interactivity: - take screenshot; verify screen capture works - test mouse operations: mouse_move to safe area; left_click; verify click registered - test keyboard: type test string; verify text entry works - test OCR: capture text area; verify OCR functionality 5: if $mode == "RMS": - nav RMS system; verify navigation works - login [RMS_USERNAME]|[RMS_PASSWORD]; verify login success - test basic RMS functions: search, view, navigate - log "RMS connection verified and functional" 6: if $mode == "OSINT": - nav OSINT sources; verify access - test search functionality; verify results - log "OSINT connection verified and functional" 7: if $mode == "conn": - establish general connection; test basic operations - verify system responsiveness; test error handling - log "General connection verified and functional" 8: create_file "Session_Log_[timestamp].txt" with content: "Session started: [timestamp] Functions check completed successfully System ready for operations Master_Instructions.txt initialized" 9: log "Functions check complete - system ready for operations" 10: exit

Description: Search COPWARE db via NLP query synthesize answer & cite sources
Workflow Steps: 1: call FC (foc conn) 2: nav "content.copware.com"; if insecure warn click elsewhere to dismiss 3: login [COPWARE_USERNAME]|[COPWARE_PASSWORD]; CRITICAL: click mouse into PW field do not Tab 4: find/click "Advanced Search" 5: type keywords from $Question in search fld; subm 6: loop res: OCR src name; click link; OCR doc txt; if info suff break; else click "Next Hit Doc" 7: comp summ of all finds; fmt JSON out: {summary citations}

Description: DANGER: Perm del dataPull_Arch all desktop logs/txt & empty Recycle Bin
Workflow Steps: 1: if $CONFIRM != "CONFIRM_PURGE" log "Err: Confirmation mismatch. Aborting." ; exit 2: nav Desktop 3: del "dataPull_Arch"; del "*.txt"; R-click Recycle Bin - - 4: log "Purge complete." ; exit

Description: force FC (full/partial ex $mode=full/rms_only)
Workflow Steps: 1: log "Forced FC init mode: $mode"; call FC; out FC JSON

Description: self eval ($mode=full/diag/prompt_anlyz/etc)
Workflow Steps: 1: log "Self-eval init mode: $mode" 2: if $mode == "full": run comprehensive self-evaluation; check all workflows; test connections 3: if $mode == "diag": run diagnostic checks; identify system issues 4: if $mode == "prompt_anlyz": analyze prompt effectiveness; suggest improvements 5: collect performance metrics; analyze success rates; identify issues 6: format results as JSON: {evaluation_type success_rate issues_found recommendations} 7: log "Self-evaluation complete"; exit

Description: hndl unfmt qry
Workflow Steps: 1: anlyz $Q_TXT NLP intent; create POA; extr info; fmt JSON

Description: RMS pers srch
Workflow Steps: 1: call FC (foc RMS); nav person search; enter $LN/$FN; subm; OCR extr; fmt JSON

Description: RMS case/incident srch
Workflow Steps: 1: call FC (foc RMS); nav case search; enter $CN; subm; OCR extr; apply DRT

Description: RMS addr srch
Workflow Steps: 1: call FC; nav Addr Srch; inp $HN|$ST; subm; extr; JSON

Description: RMS plate srch
Workflow Steps: 1: call FC (foc RMS); nav plate search; enter $PN; subm; OCR extr; fmt JSON

Description: Verify keyboard and mouse input mappings
Workflow Steps: 1: if "keyboard" or "full" launch notepad type test string verify combos (Ctrl+A/C/V); launch browser to keyboardchecker.com test special keys. 2: if "mouse" or "full" test click drag scroll wheel; verify precision. 3: if "full" test input combinations; verify system responsiveness. 4: log results; exit

Description: System initialization and readiness check
Workflow Steps: 1: log "Initializing dataPull agent system..." 2: call FC (foc RMS) # Run comprehensive functions check 3: verify Master_Instructions.txt exists; if not recreate from template 4: create_file "Session_Log_[timestamp].txt" for current session 5: log "System initialization complete - ready for RFIs" 6: log "Sys rdy RFIs" 7: exit

Description: Check warrant status for subject ID in jurisdiction
Workflow Steps: 1: call FC (foc RMS) 2: nav warrant search interface 3: enter $SID in subject field; select $JUR from jurisdiction dropdown 4: subm; wait for results 5: OCR extract warrant details: status date issued agency 6: if active warrant: log "ACTIVE WARRANT FOUND"; extract full details 7: if no warrant: log "No active warrants found" 8: format results as JSON: {subject_id jurisdiction warrant_status details} 9: exit

Description: Generate incident report for date range and location
Workflow Steps: 1: call FC (foc RMS) 2: nav incident reporting interface 3: set date range to $DR; set location filter to $LOC 4: subm; wait for results 5: OCR extract incident details: case numbers dates locations types 6: for each incident: extract full details including narrative 7: compile comprehensive report 8: format as JSON: {date_range location incidents summary} 9: exit

Description: Search for property by description and serial number
Workflow Steps: 1: call FC (foc RMS) 2: nav property search interface 3: enter $IDESC in description field; enter $SNUM in serial field 4: subm; wait for results 5: OCR extract property details: make model serial status 6: if found: extract full property record including history 7: if not found: log "Property not found in database" 8: format results as JSON: {description serial_number property_details} 9: exit

Description: Run facial recognition on image against known subjects
Workflow Steps: 1: call FC (foc OSINT) 2: nav facial recognition interface 3: upload image from $IMG_URL 4: if $SNAM provided: search against specific subject database 5: if no $SNAM: run general facial recognition search 6: wait for processing results 7: OCR extract match details: confidence score subject info 8: if match found: extract full subject details 9: format results as JSON: {image_url search_subject matches confidence} 10: exit

Description: Find associates and connections via OSINT sources
Workflow Steps: 1: call FC (foc OSINT) 2: nav OSINT search interface 3: enter $SNAM in search field 4: set search depth to $DEPTH (1=direct 2=associates 3=extended) 5: subm; wait for results 6: OCR extract associate details: names relationships connections 7: for each associate: extract additional details 8: build relationship network map 9: format results as JSON: {subject_name search_depth associates network} 10: exit

Description: Extract and analyze narrative from case ID
Workflow Steps: 1: call FC (foc RMS) 2: nav case details interface 3: enter $CID in case number field 4: subm; wait for case to load 5: navigate to narrative section 6: OCR extract full narrative text 7: analyze narrative for key details: persons locations times events 8: extract any additional narrative sections 9: format results as JSON: {case_id narrative_text analysis key_details} 10: exit

Description: Explore RMS system capabilities and structure
Workflow Steps: 1: call FC (foc RMS) 2: login $USER|$PASS 3: nav main menu; explore available modules 4: for each module: test basic functionality 5: document system capabilities and limitations 6: identify key navigation paths 7: test search functions across modules 8: create system map and documentation 9: format results as JSON: {system_capabilities modules navigation_paths limitations} 10: exit

Description: Generate comprehensive address report
Workflow Steps: 1: call FC (foc RMS) 2: nav address search interface 3: enter $ADDRESS in search field 4: subm; wait for results 5: extract address details: property info owner history 6: search for all incidents at address 7: extract associated persons and vehicles 8: compile comprehensive address profile 9: format results as JSON: {address property_info incidents persons vehicles} 10: exit

Description: Get call for service history for address in date range
Workflow Steps: 1: call FC (foc RMS) 2: nav CAD call search interface 3: enter $ADDRESS in address field 4: set date range to $DATE_RANGE 5: subm; wait for results 6: OCR extract call details: dates times types responses 7: for each call: extract full details including narrative 8: analyze call patterns and frequency 9: format results as JSON: {address date_range calls patterns analysis} 10: exit

Description: Find known persons associated with address
Workflow Steps: 1: call FC (foc RMS) 2: nav address search interface 3: enter $ADDRESS in search field 4: subm; wait for results 5: navigate to associated persons section 6: OCR extract person details: names DOBs relationships 7: for each person: extract additional details 8: compile person database for address 9: format results as JSON: {address known_persons details relationships} 10: exit

Description: Find vehicles associated with address
Workflow Steps: 1: call FC (foc RMS) 2: nav address search interface 3: enter $ADDRESS in search field 4: subm; wait for results 5: navigate to vehicle section 6: OCR extract vehicle details: makes models plates owners 7: for each vehicle: extract registration and history 8: compile vehicle database for address 9: format results as JSON: {address vehicles details registrations} 10: exit

Description: Check for weapons information at address
Workflow Steps: 1: call FC (foc RMS) 2: nav address search interface 3: enter $ADDRESS in search field 4: subm; wait for results 5: search for weapons-related incidents 6: OCR extract weapons details: types serial numbers status 7: check for weapons permits or registrations 8: compile weapons information for address 9: format results as JSON: {address weapons incidents permits} 10: exit

Description: Check for hazards and safety concerns at address
Workflow Steps: 1: call FC (foc RMS) 2: nav address search interface 3: enter $ADDRESS in search field 4: subm; wait for results 5: search for hazard-related incidents 6: OCR extract hazard details: types severity dates 7: check for safety alerts or warnings 8: compile hazard assessment for address 9: format results as JSON: {address hazards safety_alerts assessment} 10: exit

Description: Deploy agent monitor script to restart agent if it dies
Workflow Steps: 1: log "Deploying agent monitor script mode: $mode" 2: if $mode == "batch": create_file "agent_monitor.bat" with content: "@echo off :loop timeout /t 30 /nobreak >nul tasklist /FI "IMAGENAME eq python.exe" /FI "WINDOWTITLE eq *dataPull*" | find "python.exe" >nul if errorlevel 1 ( echo Agent not running starting... python agency_input_form.py goto loop ) else ( echo Agent running waiting... goto loop )" 3: if $mode == "powershell": create_file "agent_monitor.ps1" with content: "while ($true) { Start-Sleep -Seconds 30 $process = Get-Process -Name python -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | Where-Object {$_.MainWindowTitle -like "*dataPull*"} if (-not $process) { Write-Host "Agent not running starting..." Start-Process python -ArgumentList "agency_input_form.py" } else { Write-Host "Agent running waiting..." } }" 4: if $mode == "both": create both batch and powershell versions with above 5: create_file "start_monitor.bat" with content: "@echo off echo Starting dataPull Agent Monitor... if exist agent_monitor.bat ( agent_monitor.bat ) else ( echo Monitor script not found. Please run the deployment first. pause )" 6: create_file "README.txt" with content: "dataPull Agent Monitor This monitor automatically restarts the dataPull agent if it stops running. Usage: 1. Run _DEPLOY_AGENT_MONITOR|batch (or powershell) 2. Run start_monitor.bat 3. The monitor will check every 30 seconds and restart if needed To stop: Close the command window or press Ctrl+C" 7: log "Agent monitor deployment complete" 8: exit
